Label.text: Rules and Gameplay
Before you start
All that you need to play are 2 Dice, This app, and all of your friends!
Game Play
Each player will roll the dice when it is their turn. The scorekeeper will record the sum of both dice to the app after each roll. Its as simple as that... or is it?
First 3 rolls
• Double 1's (Snake eyes) are worth 200.
• Double 6's (12) are worth 200.
• 7's are worth 100.
• All other numbers are scored as face value.
• No doubles apply except 1's and 6's
After 3rd roll
• Double 1's and Double 6's multiply the score by 2.5 (100 would become 250)
• Any other Double will DOUBLE the rounds current score.
• If a 7 is rolled, the round ENDS.
• All other numbers are scored as face value.

Between any round, any player can LOCK their score. If the score is getting high, and you are afraid that someone will roll a 7 and end the round, you can lock your score in. This will add the rounds current score to your total, and you will be out for the round. If you do not lock before a 7 is rolled, you are rewarded 0 points for the round
To win, you must simply have the most points at the end of all the rounds. Easy, right?
How to keep score (For the score keeper only)
Each time a player rolls, you simply click the number they roll. For all doubles besides 1's and 6's, click the doubles button to double the rounds score.

When a player wants to lock their score, simply find their name and click the lock icon next to their name. This will lock them and remove them from the list of rollers for the round. They will resume rolling in the next round.
If you make a mistake, there is an undo button. You can also unlock a player if they change their mind. But this can only be done before the next player rolls.
What is a double?
A double means that both dice that are rolled display the exact same number. ie: when rolled, both dice land with a 4 displayed.
